original: NIA!L, Hans Fredrik N :son, Civilingenjör, Skellefteå, f Skara 10/1 95 av borgm J A Kilsson o Anna Landtmanson. Studex Skara 13, stud v Upps univ 14, KTH 14—18, avg.ex där sistn år. Konstr v AB Vattenbyggn.byrån 19—27, bitr kontr o konstr v elektrif.arb i Perak hos The Perak River Hydro-Electric 371 NIELSEN Power Co Ltd, Federated Malay States, 27—30, kontr o konstr v Åtorps kraftverksbygge, Kraft AB Gullspång-Munkfors 30—33, kontr f Finnfors kraftverksbygge o dammbyggn f Storavans regl v Skellefteå stads kraftverk 34—37, f Skogsfors kraftverksbygge, Yngeredsfors Kraft AB 37—39, f Hammarforsens andra utbyggnad, Hammarforsens Kraft AB 39—41, f Selsfors kraftverksbygge, Skellefteå städs kraftverk, sed. 41. Resor: Frankr, Italien, Schweiz, Tyskl 25, Engl 13 o 27, Ostasien, Canada, USA 30. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated: NIA!L, Hans Fredrik N.:son, Civil Engineer, Skellefteå, born in Skara on January 10th, 1895, to Mayor J.A. Kilsson and Anna Landtmanson. Graduated from Skara High School in 1913, studied at Uppsala University in 1914, KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) 1914-1918, with final exams passed during the last year. Worked as a designer at AB Water Engineering Bureau from 1919 to 1927, assistant designer and contractor for electrification work in Perak at The Perak River Hydro-Electric Power Co Ltd, Federated Malay States, from 1927 to 1930, contractor and designer at Åtorp Power Plant construction, Kraft AB Gullspång-Munkfors, from 1930 to 1933, contractor for Finnfors Power Plant construction and dam construction for the regulation of Storavan Lake at Skellefteå City Power Plant from 1934 to 1937, involved in the construction of Skogsfors Power Plant, Yngeredsfors Kraft AB, from 1937 to 1939, participated in the second expansion of Hammarforsen, Hammarforsens Kraft AB, from 1939 to 1941, and worked on the construction of Selsfors Power Plant, Skellefteå City Power Plant, since 1941. Has traveled to France, Italy, Switzerland, Germany in 1925, England in 1913 and 1927, East Asia, Canada, and the United States in 1930. Member of the Swedish Society of Engineers since...
